answers.answer: The main ones are large birth weight & baby's sugar level dropping once born. Just because you gained more than expected doesn't mean you have GD.
hmm are their signs of gd i go for mine next tuesday...
I go for mine on the 25th Im nervous as crap !!

I just had my test today and find out the results monday. Im not too nervous. I wish i knew the signs....i had a coworker who got it and she was put on a diet bed rest and the baby came out fine. Thats all i really know about it.

I have a 3hr on Friday then my results on the 18th. I'm 30+3 and have only gained 17lbs. Only reason my 1hr came back slightly abnormal was bc I wasn't told to not eat before hand. So now I know I can't eat anything for 10-12 hrs before my test :(

I know a couple of signs of GD are blurred vision and extreme thirst. Don't worry too much if you do get it, its only for the last 10 weeks or so of your pregnancy, and it makes you eat soooo healthy! And that can't be a bad thing. A couple of risks involved if you dont manage your diabetes properly are a large baby, early delivery, and low blood glucose levels in the baby's blood at birth.(which means a stay in the nicu)

question: Just did my glucose test today, but won't get the results until the 20th. But my doctor and I were talking about my weight gain today. And he says he's 'interested' to see the results. And gestational diabetes was mentioned. :( I don't even know what risks come with diabetes. Help!
title: nervous!
